column1: The commonly used Standards of Care for people with gender dysphoria, including those of the World Professional Association for Transgender Health and The Royal College of Psychiatrists in the United Kingdom, as well as those standards used in many other countries, usually require that two signatures of approval from qualified mental_health professionals be provided before genital reconstructive surgery (GRS) sometimes called sexual reassignment surgery or gender confirmation surgery is undertaken.
